content:
I have had questions come up recently regarding DocumentReference classification in relation to "type" and "category".

The document in question is an immunization history document. We were attempting to locate a suitable code from http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-c80-doc-typecodes.html to associate, but I was not able to find anything that really matched. There is LOINC 82593-5 "Immunization Summary Report", but that is not available within the FHIR preferred type value set.

Is this something where we should be using as a "category" classification instead? 11369-6 "History of Immunization Narrative" is another one for example. If so, in this scenario, and ones similar, is it acceptable to have a document type of 11503-0 "Medical records"?

Another document that we've had other "type" and "category" association discussions around are advanced directives.

I'm not as concerned specifically with each individual document that comes up, I am more-so looking for any guidance to help when there does not appear to be a relatable type code in the preferred set. Hope my examples help!

Thanks
@Lisa Nelson and I want to come up with better valueset. What you find is 10 years old and very USA driven at the time.
Here is an IHE wiki page with links to various regions valueset for category (classCode) etc. https://wiki.ihe.net/index.php/Metadata_Handbook
@Jose Costa Teixeira @Keith Boone @David Pyke and others might also help
